August 30* 1962
Mr. Raymond 0* Hurlbert
General. Manager
Alabama Educational Television Commission
2131 Highland Avenue
Birmingham 5* Alabama
Dear Ray)
i AM OEEPLY GRATEFUL FOR THE GENEROUS AND FLATTERING COMMENTS CONTAINED
IN YOUR LETTER OF AUGUST 20, AND YOUR CONCERN ABOUT MV RUMORED WITHDRAWAL
FROM THE NAEB.
I HAD HOPED TO WRITE SlLL HARLEY A LONG EXPLANATION OF MY POINT OF VIEW
BUT SOMEHOW ALL MANNER OF CRISES HAVE INTERVENED* I AM NEITHER DISILLUSIONED,
DISGUSTED, ANGRY, NOR FRUSTRATED, ANO ANY ACTION I TAKE WILL BE TAKEN ONLY
AFTER CALM ANO THOUGHTFUL CONSIDERATION* THIS CONSIDERATION WILL HINGE
UPON MY OFTEN EXPRESSED CONVICTIONS THAT NAEB CANNOT BE BOTH A TRADE ASSOCIA¬
TION, A PROGRAM PRODUCER AND A PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION. IT CAN GAIN STRENGTH
ANO GROW ONLY IF IT MAKES UP ITS MIND TO BE ONE OF THESE* IT IS MY CONVIC¬
TION THAT IT SHOULO BE A PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATION, NOT UNLIKE ITS COUNTER¬
PARTS IN THE OTHER PROFESSIONS OF MEDICINE, LAW AND TEACHING*
MV RUMORED WITHDRAWAL FROM NAEB IS GREATLY EXAGERATEO* MY CURRENT INTENT
IS NOT TO RENEW THE MEMBERSHIP OF KQED IN THE NAEB WHEN IT EXPIRES* THIS
INTENDED ACTION IS BASED UPON MY CONVICTION THAT NAEB DOES NOT, NOR SHOULO
IT, RBCRESENT KQED AS A STATION. ON THE OTHER HAND, » FEEL IT DOES REPRESENT
ME, AS ONE PROFESSIONAL EMPLOVEO IN THE EDUCATIONAL TELEVISION BUSINESS*
i PROPOSE THEREFORE NOT ONLY TO MAINTAIN AN INDIVIDUAL MEMBERSHIP IN THE
NAEB, BUT TO ENCOURAGE MY EMPLOYEES TO DO LIKEWISE*
I NOTEO WITH GREAT INTEREST A BRIEF ITEM IN THE NAEB NEWSLETTER, IN A
SPEECH AT THE OHIO STATE INSTITUTE, APPARENTLY INDICATED THAT THIS WAS TO
BE THE FUTURE DIRECTION OF THE NAEB* I AM SURPRISED AND DISAPPOINTED THAT
I HAVE REAO NOTHING FURTHER ABOUT THIS PLAN. I PRESUME MUCH MORE WILL BE
said in Philadelphia*
